instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2914: What is 820-2914? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but fans spin fast. Also the battery does not charge. Ran ASD and received several SMC IO errors. Already replaced SMC. What to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message:
AnY history available, liquid signs?
Post exact <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage.
Also diode mode and voltage for SCL/SDA lines of battery bus; w/ and w/o battery connected.

Check traces and solders around <CHIP>U5570</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message:
yes this has been messed with before. Wrong GPU soldered at moment 216-081005 instead of 216-0810084 but plan on changing to correct NEW GPU before giving back. No liquid signs but glue removed from mux and PCH but do not think these are the issues since it boots into OSX just very slow.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.60V

diode mode SCL/SDA 0.488 0.488 w/o battery connected  0.441 0.431 w battery connected

voltages SCL/SDA w/o battery connected 3.480v 3.480V  voltages w battery connected 3.475v  2.105v

<CHIP>U5570</CHIP> area is in perfect shape

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message:
Battery is bad.

Try known good TP board/flex.
Also test it without camera connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message:
TP currently works in ASD and OSX, how can it be bad then?

Disconnecting camera does not make a difference

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2914</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sensor issues
threads.message:
TP has temp sensor embedded.
I didn't say TP is bad!

Camera connector is shared by ALS sensor too; which connects on the same I2C bus with temp sensors.
